channel.title: least common multiple on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in least common multiple on Notes

item.title: MATH102-lecture-20220210
item.description: 3T solutions # Least common multiples # Consider \( a = 2^2 \cdot 5^4 \cdot 7 \cdot 41^{10} \) and \( b = 5^2 \cdot 19 \cdot 41 \cdot 47^2 \) . If \( M \) is a common multiple of \( a \) and \( b \) , that means that \( a | M \) and also \( b | M \) .
